column4: i just installed ubuntu and it will not allow me to update it. it says that i don't have enough disk space. but i have well over 15 gigs of free memory. i also have windows xp on this computer, could that be causing problems?
Filesystem            Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on
Well, you don't have _any_ free space.
tmpfs, varrun, varlock, and udev are _virtual_ filesystems - they only exist in RAM.
First, Ubuntu doesn't know about your Windows partition yet.
Second, you _must_ have free space in the Ubuntu partition for it to work correctly.
It just doesn't show anything, but it does accept the password.
You can just resize the partitions.
Go to http://paste.ubuntu.com/, paste your text there, click Submit, and give us the address.
If you had any free space in /, I would ask you to add this line to /etc/fstab... /dev/sda1 /media/windows ntfs-3g auto,fmask=0111,dmask=0000,utf8,uid=1000 0 0
